intro: Proboscidea parviflora var. hohokamiana, commonly known as the Hohokamian bottle-gourd, is a variant of the bottle-gourd plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its elongated, cylindrical fruit that can grow up to several feet in length. The plant is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other gourd species. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The flowers are typically yellow and occur in both male and female forms, with the female flowers developing into the edible fruits.
